Key Match Events: Ireland made 157 and bowled superbly to restrict England to 105 for five when rain stopped play and Ireland took victory under the DLS method.
Captain Andy Balbirnie’s 62 off 47 balls underpinned Ireland’s 157 all out in 19.2 overs.
England lurched to 86 for five under heavy cloud cover and, despite a late burst of boundaries from Moeen Ali, they were still short of the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern par when the heavens opened.
England, on 105 for five when the downpour started, slipped to a five-run defeat under the DLS method.
Ireland got off to a flyer with Chris Woakes leaking 41 from his three overs as they reached 103 for one after 11.5 overs.
Mark Wood took three for 34, while Liam Livingstone also claimed his first three-wicket haul in an England shirt.
Fionn Hand castled Ben Stokes through the gate with one that zipped back in as England lurched to 37 for three after the powerplay.

Moeen Ali counter-attacked amid a drizzle, launching left-arm spinner Dockrell for a straight six with a heave across the line, but the shower grew heavier and after a 10-minute wait, Ireland were declared winners.
Adil Rashid deflected Balbirnie’s drive on to the non-striker’s stumps, meaning Lorcan Tucker was out for 34.
Mark Wood tickled the edge of Harry Tector.
Wood sconed Curtis Campher then had him caught behind down the leg-side before finishing his spell by clattering Gareth Delany in the helmet.
Livingstone had his third wicket when Mark Adair picked out Curran, whose yorkers at the death took out Barry McCarthy and Hand as Ireland failed to bat out their overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain had led to two brief delays at the outset of the contest after Ireland had been asked to bat first.
The only previous T20 between these teams in 2010 was also impacted by rain, which forced a no-result with the game tantalisingly poised.
